Class Formatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Formatter

  • public class Formatter
extends java.lang.Object
    Formatter helps TSVPipeline make sure the file chosen is in the right format. If the file isn't in the right format, the records that don't match are removed. Any extra whitespace between fields in a record are removed. Formatter writes the File after the modifications are done.
    Author:
    Tian Low ttl2132

    • Field Detail

      • firstLine

        public java.lang.String firstLine

      • entireFile

        public java.lang.String entireFile

    • Constructor Detail

      • Formatter

        public Formatter(java.lang.String input)
        Constructs an instance of Formatter.
        Parameters:
        input - the name of the file

    • Method Detail

      • defineFormat

        public void defineFormat()
        Determines whether the first and second lines are valid. If they are valid, the file is then cleansed of incorrectly formatted lines.

      • readFile

        public java.lang.String readFile()
        Reads the file that the user wants to format. Note that there are two sets of readers, because the first and second line are separately checked from the rest of the file.
        Returns:
        the entire file as one String

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(java.lang.String filteredFile)
        Writes the contents of the first line and the entire rest of the file to a new file. The new file has the word filtered at the front of the original name.
        Parameters:
        filteredFile - the cleansed and filtered file, or an error message

      • hasFirstLine

        public boolean hasFirstLine()
        Checks whether the first line exists and has field(s).
        Returns:
        whether the first line exists and has field(s).

      • hasFormattedSecondLine

        public boolean hasFormattedSecondLine()
        Checks whether the second line exists and has field(s) that correspond with the first line in terms of number of fields.
        Returns:
        whether the second line exists and is correctly formatted.

      • cleanseFile

        public void cleanseFile()
        Cleanses the file by checking each record if it follows the format of the first and second line. If it doesn't, the line is not put into the new file.

      • removeExtraTabs

        public java.lang.String[] removeExtraTabs(java.lang.String line)
        Removes the extra tabs in a line and returns the individual fields in the line in an array.
        Parameters:
        line - any line in the file
        Returns:
        an array of each individual field without extra space

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String[] stringArray)
        Converts String arrays to a String.
        Parameters:
        stringArray - an array with fields from a line
        Returns:
        the line as one String

      • findFormat

        public java.lang.String findFormat(java.lang.String line)
        Determines the format of each line based off of the values of the first and second line. Removes the tabs from the lines in order to align each column.
        Parameters:
        line - any line from the file
        Returns:
        the format in terms of a String of 0's and 1's. 1 means the value is a String. 0 means it is not a String.

      • hasFormat

        public boolean hasFormat(java.lang.String currentLine)
        Determines the format of each line based off of the values of the first and second line, then checks the current line's format against the second line's format.
        Parameters:
        currentLine - the line the iterator is currently on
        Returns:
        whether or not the current line's format is correct
